app.name: Swift Testing
app.one_liner: A modern, expressive testing package for Swift that provides intuitive APIs using macros to simplify test authoring and failure diagnosis.

screens.name: Test Authoring View
screens.purpose: Allows developers to define test cases with traits, expectations, and custom conditions using Swift's macro system.
primary_actions: Apply traits for runtime conditions or CI constraints

rust_commands.name: run_tests
rust_commands.purpose: Execute the test suite using Swift Package Manager or integrated tooling.

mvp_plan: week 1: Implement #expect assertion with value capture
week 1: Set up basic test declaration with @Test macro
acceptance_tests: A test declared with @Test runs successfully when its expectations pass.
Tests can be conditionally enabled using feature flags like AppFeatures.isCommentingEnabled.
When an expectation fails, the diagnostic shows the actual and expected values.
